modules.bagOfWords

Class BagOfWordsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • modules.bagOfWords.BagOfWordsHelper

  • public class BagOfWordsHelper
extends Object
    Helper class, contains various static convenience methods for Bags of Words
    Author:
    david

      Assumes that both bags of words are simple bags of words and do not contain word counts.
      static void merge(Map<String,Integer> receivingBag, Map<String,Integer> givingBag)
      Merges all words from givingBag to the receivingBag, incrementing the word counts, such that after this operation the receivingBag is a Bag of all Words in both original bags.

      Merges all words from givingBag to the receivingBag, incrementing the word counts, such that after this operation the receivingBag is a Bag of all Words in both original bags.

      Compute the Levenshtein distance, but divide it by it's upper bound, i.e.
      static TreeMap<String,Integer> tfIdfMinFilter(Map<String,Integer> bag, Map<String,Double> inverseDocumentFrequencies, float tfIdfMin)
      Produces a new copy of the Bag of Words with all words removed, whose TF-IDF value is below the given minimum value TF for a term is taken to be the word count in the bag.

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        public static void merge(Map<String,Integer> receivingBag,
                         Map<String,Integer> givingBag)
        Merges all words from givingBag to the receivingBag, incrementing the word counts, such that after this operation the receivingBag is a Bag of all Words in both original bags. The second bag of words is left as is.

      • mergeDouble

        public static void mergeDouble(Map<String,Double> receivingBag,
                               Map<String,Double> givingBag)
        Merges all words from givingBag to the receivingBag, incrementing the word counts, such that after this operation the receivingBag is a Bag of all Words in both original bags. The second bag of words is left as is.

      • inverseDocumentFrequencies

        public static Map<String,Double> inverseDocumentFrequencies(Map<String,Integer> termFrequencies,
                                                            int documentCount)
        Compute an IDF values for the terms given. IDF here is simply the number of all
        Parameters:
        termFrequencies -
        documentCount -
        Returns:

      • inverseDocumentFrequenciesDouble

        public static Map<String,Double> inverseDocumentFrequenciesDouble(Map<String,Double> termFrequencies,

        Compute an IDF values for the terms given. IDF here is simply the number of all
        Parameters:

      • tfIdfMinFilter

        public static TreeMap<String,Integer> tfIdfMinFilter(Map<String,Integer> bag,
                                                     Map<String,Double> inverseDocumentFrequencies,
                                                     float tfIdfMin)
        Produces a new copy of the Bag of Words with all words removed, whose TF-IDF value is below the given minimum value TF for a term is taken to be the word count in the bag. The IDF value for a term is provided via paramter.
        Parameters:
        bag - The Bag of Words to copy
        inverseDocumentFrequencies - The frequencies over all documents
        tfIdfMin - The minimum value below which a term should be filtered out.
        Returns:
        A new Bag of Words with all words ranking below tfIdfMin removed.

      • levenshteinDistance

        public static float levenshteinDistance(Map<String,Integer> bagOne,
                                        Map<String,Integer> bagTwo)
        Assumes that both bags of words are simple bags of words and do not contain word counts. Then computes the number of operations needed to transform one Bag of Words into another. Removal, addition and substitution of a word each have a count of 1. The input parameters bagOne and bagTwo are interchangeable.
        Parameters:
        bagOne - a TreeMap mapping Strings to counts
        bagTwo - a TreeMap mapping Strings to counts
        Returns:
        The distance computed, always a positive integer value

      • normalizedLevenshteinDistance

        public static float normalizedLevenshteinDistance(Map<String,Integer> bagOne,
                                                  Map<String,Integer> bagTwo)
        Compute the Levenshtein distance, but divide it by it's upper bound, i.e. the size of the bigger bag of words.
        Parameters:
        bagOne - a TreeMap mapping Strings to counts
        bagTwo - a TreeMap mapping Strings to counts
        Returns:
        The distance computed, floating point number between 0 and 1.0
